Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2022
Author: IT Guy
Title: Not ready for prime-time - updated review
Body: 08/26/22 update - after some fairly annoying back & forth with Vantrue support, it's confirmed that when power to the camera is cut off (e.g. you've turned off your car), the camera shuts down completely.  So, unless you hardwire it to CONTINUOUS 12v power, the camera will shut down when you turn off the car, and you will have no video coverage should someone bang into your car.  The supercapacitor mentioned in the product description does absolutely nothing to provide power in the event of something like a bump to the car or motion in its field of view regardless of which parking mode you have selected.08/23/22 - Purchased on 08/18/22 to replace an existing dashcam in my wife's car.  Spent the last few days doing some prep and waiting for some parts (e.g. split loom to protect the cable to the rear camera, 256GB mSD card, etc.) before I begin the install process.  In the meantime, I took the opportunity to update its firmware & bench test the camera before moving ahead, and discovered a few issues (at least with the unit that I received) and those of you that have purchased it may want to check your units to see if you have the same issuesTo save a lot of summarizing, I've pasted the message that I sent to Vantrue (please excuse the typos, I had to retype it several times because of site timeouts), via the form on their website, below.  I will update this in response how it's handled.--- start of message to support ---Hi,I purchased an E2 dash cam through your Amazon store and have encountered an issue with it.The E2:- is updated to the H042 firmware version,- was reset to factory defaults after the update, and- has a SanDisk 128GB high-endurance microSD that was reformatted by the E2 after the update/Currently, the E2 has the following settings configured:- Auto LCD Off - set to [Off]- Parking Mode - set to [Collision Detection] with all sensitivities set to [5]- Low-light Night Vision in Parking Mode - set to [On]Symptoms:#1 - When a continuous USB-C power source (using the Vantrue-supplied USB-A-to-USB-C cable) to the power input of its windshield mount, the camera will:- display the message [The dashcam is about to shut down and enter collision detection mode] after ~5 minutes, then- go idle - but it moving or tapping the camera will wake it up and trigger its collision mode.#2 - Disconnecting the E2 from the power supply:- causes it to shut down completely, and- it does not wake when moved or firmly tapped with a finger or pen (to simulate a collision when disconnted from continuous power.)Problems/questions:#1 - why is the camera going into its [collision mode] even when connected to continuous power, and how do I stop this behavior?#2 - why is the camera powering down and unresponsive after continuous power is disconnected?  What purpose does its super-capacitor serve, if not to enable the [collision detection] recording when the vehicle is parked & off?Is this unit defective and, if so, how do I get this rectified?

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2022
Author: bsf
Title: My long, tortuous and sad journey with vantrue
Body: Update 9/17/2002: After weeks of tests, everything points that the problem is the hardwire kit being extremely picky with my 2002 accord hybrid. I will be testing the new hardwire kit and updating the review with the new results. Upgraded the rating from 1 to 3 stars pending the results of the new tests. Kudos to the company for sticking with me and try to find a solution.Update 8/31/2022: Vantrue has been very proactive, trying to fix the problem. They sent an evaluation unit, and I've been interacting with them to try to pinpoint the problem. I need to give them credit for not abandon me, and continuing support. It is rare when a company tries really hard to improve their products. I will update again once the problem its identified.Original post: Lets first start with the TL/DR version:-If you live in a hot area (Texas, Arizona... you get the idea), hardwire this camera (using the OEM venture hardwire accessory) and turn on the low bitrate recording for parking mode... it will FAIL because the camera overheats under the sun, then shutdowns, forcing you to manually turn back the camera on.Now, the long version:My journey started like anybody else... 'hey, I bought a new car, since I love my new car, I'll buy a camera to protect my investment and my hard-earned money'. Then I saw the vantrue cameras, and they had a good deal, because Prime day, there was a nice offer. For $178, the Vantrue X4S duo seemed a good buy. Another $25 for the GPS mount, plus $25 for the hardwire kit, plus an obscene $55 for a vantrue sd (sandisk cost around $35 for the same endurance card). Installed everything, then my nightmare started. Every morning I drove to work, parked on the parking lot, when I returned the camera was kaput. Turned back the camera on, hoping the next day it was fixed. Nothing. I contacted support. Because they are based in China, they respond your emails usually the next day. After 20+ emails and several firmware versions/patches installed in the camera, the same outcome. I decided to return everything.Now, because I'm masochist, I decided to give it an opportunity to the E2 (element 2) camera. basically the same price of the X4S duo, but the main camera plus the rear one are 2K resolution (compared with the 4k front + 1k back on the X4s). As soon as I turned on the camera, a message comes to the screen "FOR HIGH TEMPERATURE PLACES, ITS RECOMMENDED THE COLLISION DETECT FOR THE PARKING MODE". So they know their cameras shuts down when the heat ramps up, but they wont automatically resume when temperatures drop down. UPDATE: sure enough, today was 101 F over Houston, the camera shuts down. When the temperature dropped, the camera stayed off. Required manually to be turned back on.There is some little improvements over the X4s-now GPS mount is included-the mount is magnetic, easier to remove the camera-the firmware is less confusing than the one in the X4s, with big icons-a little heavier than the X4s, feels a little more solidSo, buy this camera if:-you wont use the hardwire kit to keep the camera constantly recording when you turn off your car-you park your car on a covered garage, or you live underground in a cave (think Batman) or on the north/south pole. Siberia could work.-you are Ubering, and the temperature inside the cabin its not high because your poor car is working day and night moving people from one place to another.If you live in an area where a typical day is over 100F, look somewhere else. You are warned.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
Author: RedShiftRider
Title: This Thing Feels 6 Years Old
Body: There’s plenty of dashcam options out there for less than half the price that blow this thing out of the water.My previous dashcam (Kingslim D4 dual cam) that I bought 3 years ago finally failed.I settled on this camera as a replacement. It was the only camera with app functionality, dual cameras, and seemed like a decent design.I decided to return the camera 2 minutes after opening it. I can’t believe how old and outdated this thing feels. The screen is tiny, and it’s not a touch screen. The 4 hard buttons on the bottom of the camera used to navigate the menus are extremely hard to find. And very frustrating to use. Changing settings in the menus is unnecessarily difficult and clumsy.My previous camera had touch screen capability and was much easier to use. And much more user friendly. All around easier, better in basically every way. Not to mention that this camera is twice the price for no reason at all. Again, the Kinglism was purchased over 3 years ago, and this camera feels much older than that one. Although the seller says it was just released in Aug. 2022.This camera was $250 minus a $50 coupon. My old Kingslim was $100 for exactly the same features - dual cameras, app connectivity - and a bigger, more user friendly touch screen. There’s absolutely no reason this camera should be priced at over $200. It possesses no features that justify that price.On top of that, when I tried to download the app, it has a 1 star rating with everyone complaining the camera will not connect to the app after a recent update.I’ve attached a photo of this camera next to my old 3 year old camera for size reference.I’ve returned this and gone with a different option.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2025
Author: Clif. Brownlee
Title: Don’t know if it’s safe.
Body: So I’ve owned this camera for two years. I notice at about a year and a half I started getting an error message stating I had an error in the as card so I would have to restart it and it would be fine. Now I have a very good and card but last week I got into my car with the dash cam front screen broken and a piece of it in my center console. Now these cameras are designed to be in a car for extended periods so I was not worried about heat messing with it. But I was wrong the unit had swelled so bad that it cracked the front screen and warped the entire camera. I really liked the camera when it was working but now I’m afraid to purchase another in fear that my car may catch fire due to the unit exploding. I’m not sure if this unit has a battery inside cause I purchased the hardwired kit to keep it running all the time for parking mode. All in all I don’t think I could trust this brand again unless I have a faulty unit. Really disappointed.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2022
Author: Matt
Title: Great Wifi Dashcam for the price
Body: Installation and first impression- Everything needed to mount this camera is included in the box, making it easy to install.- Packaging was very friendly and sturdy, ensuring the contents would not be damaged during shipping.- The design is very sleek. The front camera reminds me of a compact GoPro, while the back camera reminds me of a desktop webcam.- The cigarette-mounted power supply has a USB port, so you don't lose a spot to charge other devices like your phone.- Electrostatic sticker is a great option for installion, I always hated 3m tape directly to the window, with this setup, no more residue if I want to remove it in the future.Features- Comes with a wireless hotkey button that you can mount anywhere. This button allows you to initiate voice commands and start an emergency video capture and snap photos. I chose to mount my next to the ignition for easy access. This is much better than fumbling to press the small emergency event button on the dashcam. Voice commands are a great addition since it lets you control the camera with less risk of affecting your driving. Most worked for me, and the microphones picked up my voice well.- 2k recording on both front and rear cameras, a sample image of both in the attached review. Remarkable in both night and day recordings. Decent for license plate recognition.- 5GHz Wi-Fi connectivity is faster and more reliable than 2.4 GHz, but it includes both for easy connection from phone to dashcam. The 5GHz connection allows for faster transfers of video clips from the dashcam to my phone.- Nice large LCD color screen, which is helpful for settings the camera and reviewing the footage if needed.- The dashcam is removable, which is great for high-risk areas like the SF bay area.- Comes with a GPS module that can record your speed and display it on the recordings, which can be helpful when getting a speeding ticket to prove innocence- UI is very intuitive and user-friendly; everything is laid out very well for easy navigation.OverviewThis camera has many features that can go head to head with many higher-priced market units. The little cameras can be attached to your front and rear window in minutes and can save you a boatload of money with video evidence in the event of an accident; having both front and back helps document the entire accident. I can highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for one.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2025
Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Rear Camera Died, Customer Service Refused Replacement
Body: This was the second vantrue front/rear camera system I have installed. First one worked great for years, this one not so much. First couple months everything worked fine then one day realized rear camera wasnt turning on. Soon after the front camera would only turn on in motion monitoring mode and stopped recording all together.I troubleshooted everything connection wise since it was hardwired into the fuse box. Plugging it in to the dash12v outlet, checked it with a multimeter. Nothing fixed it. Here's where it gets interesting.Contacted vantrues customer service for a warranty replacement. Over series of emails back and forth with basic suggestions on troubleshooting no progress was being made. They eventually told me that it was not eligible for warranty replacement since I had purchased it through a third party vendor- Amazon. Vantrue is listed as the seller on my invoice which so kindly circled for me. They also obviously have a store page on Amazon with easy to find links detailing their warranty policies....on Amazon!I eventually got this refunded through Amazon customer service even through it was beyond the return window- thank you! But I'm done buying from vantrue. You have been warned, this company will be quick to answer your emails but will do everything they can to avoid honoring their warranty policy since apparently any Vantrue product purchased on Amazon is ineligible for their warranty. Never again. Wish Garmin made a front/rear camera combo....

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2025
Author: Enr Videography
Title: CHEAP BUILD QUALITY! IT WILL MELT!!
Body: This has been a great dash cam for the past 2 years, unfortunately it is not built to last. As you can see in the pictures, this camera is made from plastic and has deformed over time. Now a little after two solid years… it no longer works!!I live in San Diego and it’s not as hot as other places!!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2022
Author: Zee
Title: Outstanding!!!
Body: Everything and more from a dashcam. So far so great. It's really well-rounded from the app to the video quality. The set up was easy for someone who isn't high-tech and the directions were clear and understandable. I appreciate being able to see the view of both the front and the back when i need to and being able to upload your videos to your phone is a huge perk. Simple and smooth. The mini remote for bookmarking is clutch for when things come up and you want to lock down your video. Furthermore, I feel it will come in handy if I ever get pulled over by the police and can turn on the audio when I need to.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2025
Author: Javier labra
Title: Faulty camera, bad service.
Body: Reconsider choosing this camera and brand. Mine is broken and I have zero answer from customer service regarding a warranty.  Worked fine when it worked. Unfortunately I would not give this brand another chance.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022
Author: welkin168
Title: only 9 days this item broken!
Body: Im get this product at 2week ago ,in 8/18 installed by labor cost (front and rear camera connection for truck) $160 ,and for 24 H parking buy battery cable conneter $15 and labor fee $55 total spend $230 for install fee ,today Im find the camera LCD screen fall off, im need return this ASAP,  please contact me ,im ready this for camping plan have to delay and changed ,thanks

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2019
Author: PTN01
Title: Good for what it is, at a low price point.
Body: Simple 3m double sided tape mount. I used it to mount an N2 pro onto the rain sensor housing. Using the suction cup mount that came with unit wasn’t an option as the rear view mirror would block most of the inner camera. It is shipped from China, so expect about a 2 week delivery.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2025
Author: Jose Joseph
Title: Not reliable and poor customer service
Body: Dashcam stopped working within 2 years. Contacted customer service and they said they won't help since warranty expired after 18 months. This is my 5th dashcam between my two cars in  5 years. Only reason I keep buying them is because of the existing hard-wiring in my cars and decent video quality compared to other brands. No more buying this brand again because of poor quality and terrible customer service.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2025
Author: Eric
Title: Doesn’t work properly
Body: The camera will stop recording during mid drive for no reason. The firmware is up-to-date, I’ve reformat the SD card, the light will blink green and it’s recording fine then all the sudden the light will go solid green and stop recording to get it to record again, I have to Unplug it from the 12 V power supply and then plug it back in. I’ve only had it for three weeks.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2025
Author: ♛ KiℝiLL ♛
Title: DONT BUY, it’s the camera NOT the SD
Body: Camera will NEVER work properly. Always randomly get a SD Card Error message, replaced with 2 brand new SD cards, Samsung Pro Ultimate and SanDisk Pro Extreme. I bought the 2 best in class SD cards, no change, it’s the camera. No point is owning a camera that always stops recording… when you need the most it won’t be recording… TRASH

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2025
Author: JD
Title: heat damage
Body: Decent features and video quality, but the plastic warps and the case expands from the heat in Arizona.Experienced this issue with two different units.  Vantrue replaced the original one with a completely new unit so no complaints with their support, but the camera is simply not durable enough for a hot environment.Anecdotally their SD cards also seem to have issues with premature death possibly due to heat, but I have no evidence to support that claim.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2022
Author: MEF
Title: Nicely packaged and easy to install. Looks like a well made product.
Body: I ordered the VANTRUE E2 to replace an existing dash cam that did NOT have a rear camera. I also like that the unit uses a capacitor and not a battery.The unit arrived the next day, thanks Vantrue and Amazon; I charged the unit overnight from a USB cube.Very nice packaging (Image 1 and 2). Everything was well organized. Clearly some thought went into the packaging and marketing.I liked the security sticker on the box in addition to the shrink wrap (Image 3). The quick start guide had clear and easy to understand graphics (Image 4).Under the quick start guide (layer 1 of the box) contained the camera and mini remote nestled in a protective formed foam holder along with box that contained the camera mount and the USB C power cable (Image 5). All of the included items laid out to see...the inclusion of a nylon panel tool made the hiding of the cables quick and simple (Image 6).The camera installed and operating (the screen can be on or off, front, or rear camera or both with an insert (image 7 and 8). The cigarette outlet mounted power supply with spare USB power outlet...another nice touch (Image 9). Lastly the rearview camera mounted on the rear window (Image 10). The exposed wire is temporary. As this is an SUV, the rear cable install will take a bit more work. I plan to remove the trim and snake the cable from the roof into the hatch, along with the other electrical connections.Overall, the installation took about 45 minutes, including the running and hiding of the cables and adjustments of the view.The camera settings were easily completed via the camera mounted buttons. Once I installed the APP all of the setting were super easy to access and manipulate from the App once the WiFi was connected.That's it for now. I'll post some in video of the cameras and an update on my observations in a few days.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2025
Author: Rodolfo Galvez
Title: Not a quality product
Body: Avoid this camera at all costs if you live in the heat of the South. It will overheat and stop recording. Messages will come on that tell you it is overheating and the screen will go blank.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2025
Author: Andrew Torgerson
Title: Worked for a while then had problems
Body: Worked fine for a few months then get the dreaded ‘SD CARD ERROR’ and now it is useless. Bought a new card, tried resetting it, tried all the troubleshooting…. And now have a dash cam that doesn’t record, so what’s the point?

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020
Author: Topher
Title: sticks to the windshield, even in hot sun
Body: The suction cut that came with the N2 Pro cam was good for a few weeks. Despite thoroughly cleaning the glass, suction cut, double-sided tape and all kinds of internet tips & tricks, the suction cup always gives out. This happens most often when car sits in the sun outside.. which is pretty much when it's not at night. It happened so often that we just left the dashcam in the glove box.When I found this adhesive windshield mount for the dashcam, i figured it would solve the suction cup issue and it did. We've had a few hot days, car parked outside and windshield gets heated up... yup, the mount & cam still there. Another benefit of this... the locking ring at the ball joint also keeps the cam pointed right where I want it. That that also problem with factory mount... the ball joint was loose - drive a little too fast around a turn... the cam gets tilted sideways. This mount also fixes that issue.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2019
Author: RPM
Title: Better than supplied suction mount
Body: The spot around my mirror has a black tint from the factory that has a slight texture to it.  Using the suction cut mount was only good for about an hour before it would release and drop on the dash (camera and all).  This mount not only allows me to stick it to this area, it also is smaller so I could tuck it up higher.  Now it is not only secure, but up so high it is behind the rear view mirror and not in my line of sight.  Perfect.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
Author: Jerome Clemente
Title: Vantrue E2 Dash Cam is worth the asking price!
Body: Vantrue E2 Dash Cam is worth the asking price!The Vantrue E2 is a 2 channel (2Kfront/2K rear) dash cam that produces amazing video's and images. The unit is equipped with a super capacitor battery that is designed for extreme heat and cold regions.  The install for the front unit was very easy - the instructions were very simple and easy to understand.  The E2 does not use standard Vantrue suction cups for mounting but an electrostatic sticker for the windshield and  2 sided tape.  I wish Vantrue offered both types of mounting options so the user can chose whichever works best for their application.  I'm not sure how the sticker method will hold up with the heat wave the Bay Area is currently experiencing.  The rear camera was a bit tricky to install because the wires was somewhat difficult to snake into the headliner and tailgate of my vehicle.I upgraded from a Vantrue S1 cam and the image reproduction is significantly a night and day difference.  It should be since the S1 is only a 1080P vs E2 1440P.  One of selling points of the E2 is the built in wifi so you can easily download the files by using the Vantrue App (3 minute video loop files takes a while to Dl because of the file size).  So you can show the officer after the event what really happened instead of having to DL the video with a PC.  A feature I like is the voice control - user can command the unit to take a pic, turn on/off wifi, turn off screen.  Another feature I want to mention is the handy remote if you do not want to use the voice control feature - to just take random pics of cool cars, people crossing the street, planes overhead, etc.Overall the Vantrue E2 is an amazing dash cam for the price and will surprise you with the numerous options it offers!  Amazing videos/picture reproduction during day time and pretty good in low light (manufacturers have not mastered the night yet).The only gripes I have:1. The plug for the rear cam should be on the side instead of the top2. Offer 2 type of mounting options the electrostatic tape method and suction cups (so I can use the suction cups whenever I rent a car.3.  The Circular Polarizing Lens should have been included (i have major reflections/glare from my leather dash)4. Vantrue should manufacture flat wires so hiding wires should be a breeze5. Offer cloud storage and live view similar to Thinkware and BlackVue6. The car charger should have been a plug and dual port USB version. So I can connect the power cable to a ext battery pack like Rav Power for extended parking mode.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2022
Author: Catina
Title: Huge upgrade to the N2 with Crystal clear videos!
Body: I am upgrading from the Vantrue N2 dash cam and its a much better camera. The quality of Vantrue remain too notch in 2022. The camera looks to be well made and sturdy. The new design is super slim and sleek looking. Much smaller profile than the previous N2. I was able to set up and get it going under 30mins!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
Author: Luan N.
Title: Initial Review
Body: Packaging:The Vantrue E2 dash cam comes in a nice little box with everything you should need for installing the cam as a plug and play. For hardwiring you will need to purchase the hardwire kit from Vantrue, and maybe a longer car trim/panel puller depending on your vehicle.Installation & Set Up:Installation of the dash cam with the hardwire kit took me about 2.5 hours to route and hide all of the wiring, installing both front & rear cam. Setting up the dash to the app should be simple, just read through the provided guide. Recording settings is complete done out of the box so you likely won't be messing to much with it.Quality:After taking it out for a short drive, I rewatched the video and the quality is nice and crisp as expected.The dash cam and mount feels very stable and solid. The mounting style of this camera is using an electrostatic sticker and 3M tape, so I will have to see how well it holds up to the AZ heat.The parking mode has several options, the one that was recommended for hot climate was "Collision Detection", they also have the "Motion Detection" as well which I'm guessing could cause the camera to overheat if there is a significant amount of traffic (I'll have to test this option little more).

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
Author: Quoc-Anh N.
Title: Easy Install Front and Rear Cameras
Body: I have been wanting to replace my dashcam that I have been using for the last 5 years.  This dashcam has all the bells and whistles you could want in a dashcam!  The boxing was elegant and efficient.  It comes with both a electro-static pad or double sided tape.  Be sure to clean your windshields before applying the electro-static pad.  It has Wi-Fi that you have to manually connect to the phone when you want to view videos.  Its got in built-in GPS with speed display.  The compact design of the camera is easy to setup.  The mount is magnetic so the camera just clicks right in.  Once you power on the camera, the setup took less than 5 minutes.  This camera is mini but powerful!  The picture quality is fantastic and major upgrade from my old camera.  It also comes with a small remote that does one touch snapshots.  I highly recommend this dashcam!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2022
Author: Andy Murray
Title: Ease of use
Body: Product was easy to install in my 2021 Tunda and the cables are easy to hide. Most difficult part I’m dealing with is the rear camera but I will find a way to mount it without having it on the window that rolls down.  (Full size window rolls down, not partial).

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2025
Author: Nizam Makki
Title: not perfect quality
Body: GPS not working.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2025
Author: MKM
Title: Half doody
Body: The rear camera doesn't workLoop feature only captures the events it chooses are collision.  Not a continuous record.Edit:Seller reached out address the issue.  After I responded they have not reached back out.  Since April 4th.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2025
Author: F. Bacon
Title: Stops recording arbitrarily, making it 100% UNreliable
Body: I am so disappointed in this camera.  I had it professionally installed with the Vantrue cable kit.  And the bottom line is this camera is unreliable. It arbitrarily just stops recording.  I find myself constantly checking to ensure the green light is flashing (indicator that it is actively recording), so at this point it has become a distraction.  NOT GOOD.  I have swapped out the unit, I have reformatted and swapped out the memory card, I have updated the firmware.  Vantrue's recommendation was to use the cigarette adapter power cord to see if that resolves the issue.  The unit isn't losing power.  It just isn't reliable and doesn't work properly.When it DOES record, the picture is great.This is my first dash cam so I am finding the wifi connection to be very wonky...truly everything about this unit feels wonky.I do NOT recommend it, and only gave it 2 stars because when it is recording I can't fault the actual recording.  They look good.  But the unreliability is a complete deal breaker here.  I've glanced at it SO MANY TIMES to realize it's not recording...and grateful that something didn't happen in that moment.  What's the point in even having the thing if it's a crap shoot if it's going to be recording when you need it to.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2025
Author: Uma Ratna Sai pulaparthy
Title: Too much price with normal quality
Body: Unable to capture the Name plate , video quality is not as expected

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2022
Author: Jamie
Title: Should be included
Body: Two stars because I was forced to buy this extra: the suction mount included with my cam is a joke, even after careful cleaning of the windshield it wouldn't stay attached more than a day. Vantrue if you're reading this, put one in the box, raise the price to cover it, your customers will be happier.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
Author: Abaddona D.
Title: Quick and easy!
Body: The cameras are super easy to install and set up. The design is sleek, video quality is great! So far I am loving the new set up. I’ll update again after some use.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2022
Author: Rick L
Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Body: Bought this camera to replace an older camera i've had for years, this new one was a fantastic update to my vehicle. This was so simple to install and the video clarity far exceeded my expectations and is fantastic! Love the way it attaches to the windshield, such and improvement over my old camera, which use to fall off during the heat. This one, uses an electrostatic sticker then 3m tape on the camera, which means it will not fall off during the hot summer months! The app is so simple to use to set up the camera and view the live image. I am in love with this camera already! Great job Vantrue!

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2019
Author: L. C. Gasper
Title: Secure, adjustable.
Body: This is far, far better than the suction mount that came with the camera. The sticky tape really does stick. But if you make a mistake in placement, you can use the spare tape the seller includes with the mount. The swivel has a tightening collar that is easy to work and enables exact aiming. This mount is underpriced for what it does.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2025
Author: Mazariegos
Title: Excellent for 18 months only…
Body: Installed on my wife’s car and worked well for about 2 years.  Supercapacitor erupted and ruined dashcam.  Vantrue says warranty is only 18 months no matter what.  Seems Vantrue cameras are not worth a premium like I paid for it.  My Garmin 67 is going strong at 5 years…lesson learned.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2025
Author: Placeholder
Title: Mounts are NOT magnetic
Body: Vantrue description says camera mounts are magnetic but they are NOT. Mounts are adhesive and will not work in Phoenix extreme heat

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2025
Author: n
Title: no good
Body: died after a year.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2025
Author: Bertram
Title: Works, not rotatable
Body: It's good, works in day and night, video quality isn't so good, but see-able.And it's not rotatable, so... don't get it or place it at a good spot before just sticking it to your front and rear windshields.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2025
Author: Charlotte
Title: Best camera on the market!
Body: I have been searching for a good car cam for awhile. I researched hours until I came across this one. Setup was fairly simple and pretty straightforward. Just don’t forget to download the app on ur phone as well. The quality on these cameras is great! I was in a motor vehicle accident recently and am so glad I had these. I was able to pull up the video right from my phone to show the insurance company I was not at fault. I contacted customer service about some replacement parts I needed due to my accident and they have been extremely helpful and so nice. I highly recommend this product

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2022
Author: NGUYENR
Title: Very good picture quality! Install was super easy
Body: I'll update with pictures later - install was very straight forward. The new mounting system makes sticking it to your windshield easy so you can adjust the view. I kind of like that the wifi requires enabling to connect - the old units always had wifi on and my phone would connect to it. That kills your internet. The video is clear and it detects movement very well.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021
Author: dannyboyinaz
Title: Vantrue N2 PRO, N2, X3, T2 and R3  dash cam (non-GPS) adhesive mount
Body: This adhesive mount for my N2 PRO dash camera was just what I needed. The camera suction mount that was included with my dash camera was NOT doing the job and the camera would continually fall off of the windshield. Since I have installed the dash camera with this mount, I have not had ANY problems what so ever with it falling. The price for this mount was less than $8.00 and has worked perfectly.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2023
Author: Van2000
Title: Excellent cam with little discomfort
Body: Plus:1. Camera is just bigger than a match box. Rf: pic2. Voice command works good. "Turn off screeen", "lock the video". Not avilable with Viofo cams.3. Bluetooth is important for me to mute the cam when i talk personal. For Viofo cam this is added cost4. Cam sits behind the rear view mirror is not able to access when needed. That is where the voice command and bluetooth helps a lot5. Wifi is a direct connection between cam and mobile. Its like your mobile is using cam wifi.6.  Resolution of 2.5K with 24FPS is a plus in daylight.but reduce it to 2k with 30 fps. Night time requires more fps.7. The gps literally gives alert on traffic cameras8. The hardwire wire comes with fuse wire attachments. Viofo does not.9. Hardwire (additional cost) is a plaing wire. Does not have cylinder kind of a end as it is in Vifio. One reason why i returned vifio.Minus:1. Rear cam wire is bigger in width than a Dell laptop. Rf pic. First one was my dell laptop wire. Second one is the rear cam wire. Third one is the front cam.2. The front cam wire comes with car charger. I was hoping the wire to be usb and an additional car charge adapter. My kia has the car charger backside of the deiver seat has it has lots of USB in the front.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2022
Author: Savas
Title: Easy Installation and Operation
Body: The new mounting system is very nice.  Have to be very careful on placement and getting rid of air bubbles.  Cords are easily hidden and have ample length.  I used the provided cables for now, however, will be getting the direct connect kit to take advantage of the parking features for recording.The monitor if very clear front and rear, however for this senior, not easily viewed.  Not a problem as eyes should be on the road not the camera monitor.Just returned from Fl and camera mountings took the heat and stayed on the glass.I purchased the Vantrue card and filter; both worked just fine.Very satisfied with the performance of the camera.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
Author: jesus montes
Title: No sirve
Body: No sirve no la compren ,no baja los videos

Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2024
Author: JR
Title: Good customer service
Body: I ordered 3 dash cams ( 2 E2s and 1 E3) for me, my nephew and niece but ended up using 2 of them for myself as my niece didn't want one. My cameras so far haven't fallen off, but my nephew's cams were falling off. Not too sure if his wasn't installed properly, but I emailed Vantrue and they did not hesitate sending me replacement stickers. I have to say they were very prompt with replying to my email(s) to remedy the issue. I say emails because I didn't realize that the first 2 replies they sent were getting routed to the spam folder...totally my fault for overlooking it. The 3rd email I was able to catch and they sent the replacement stickers once I gave them my address.On a separate note I've been very happy with my dashcams so far and the clarity is better than I thought it would be. I'm not too sure how much of a difference there is between 2.7K and 4K video displays, but the 2.7K on my dash cams serves it's purpose. The only issue I have had was the video display on my phone would freeze up once in a while and I have to close the Vantrue app and tap it back to get the video to come on live again. As a first time user of dash cam I wanted to see what the cameras were seeing, but now that I've had the cams for a while I don't even connect my phone anymore except to go into the settings to turn the interior camera off on the E3 model. Not a deal breaker and to me it's a very minor issue and not a good reason to deduct a star. Overall I would recommend Vantrue and have in fact recommended it to my friend and she just ordered one.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2024
Author: Marc McKinnon
Title: Great Camera & Better Customer Service
Body: My dash cam had an issue outside the warranty dates and they still came through and replaced my dash cam at no charge. They have a Great Customer Service team.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2023
Author: Nicholas Drossos
Title: Awesome cam
Body: If you say “that’s a big one, yeah” in a slight Mexican voice it takes a photo Lol

Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2025
Author: Edwin M.
Title: Excellent product, excellent camera resolution, no detail is lost. Highly recommended.
Body: We needed a camera system for our tow trucks with excellent resolution and this has been the best image quality found.La mejor solucion para evidencia en caso de accidentes o reglamos de daños.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
Author: MG
Title: Easy to install and fine video resolution (Hardwire setup separately)
Body: This is a truly plug-in-and-go dash cam. If you just connect the cable included in the box to your vehicle's cigar outlet, your dash cam is all set and ready to record. I'd give an extra credit for that. However, if you want to hardwire setup, you will need to buy a hardwire kit separately. The setup is quite a hassle, but it is worth a penny since this will clean up your cable as well as allow you to keep using your cigar outlet.Video quality is very satisfactory. You'll get a very clean and wide-view video recording results. I have not used the wifi function yet, but if you need the function, I guess that's also a plus.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2022
Author: Jiang
Title: The dash cam that worth trying
Body: I have purchased the Vanture N2 dash cam before and I decided to give this dash cam a try for its function of reviewing footage on phone. The dash cam comes in with a nice package of all the items you need to install the dash cam. Overall it’s easy to install and it has guides in the manual on how to hide the wire. The dash cam has overall great video quality. It is sensitive to the surroundings and it snaps a pic right away when the car has an impact as I try to hide the wire. Overall I think it is worth the price it is listed for.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2022
Author: Texan
Title: Excellent dual camera dash cam system
Body: I own two other Vantrue dash cams and have been very happy with them. I wanted a new camera that supported WiFi 5 and came with both front and rear cameras. Voice control was also a requirement since the dash cam is usually hidden behind the rear view mirror and not reachable by the driver.I am impressed by the video quality from both cameras. Two separate video files are created so you can look at them independently. The cameras were easy to install using the included electrostatic stickers from 3M. Spare stickers are included in case you need to move the cameras in the future. With the new design mount of this camera, the camera is easy to remove. The voice control works well. You can tell the camera to take a photo and enable or disable the microphone. Also with the customizable shock sensor sensitivity, the camera will automatically take photos and isolate videos before/after an incident. I highly recommend Vantrue dash cams based on my previous experience with the brand.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022
Author: Imran Khan
Title: Videos are very detailed and high definition
Body: The front camera has a big size screen you can see every detail from. I love how it shows your speed and you can also see the rear camera in it as well. I love this camera

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2022
Author: Brandon Rivera
Title: Great quality. Easy to install and use.
Body: Bought a new vehicle to replace my older car so it was time to get a dash cam. I am very happy with the value of the E2. It was super easy to install and get setup. It comes with a great manual and plenty of supplies to get setup. The cables it came with were long enough to allow routing to hide the cable. I like the wifi feature which let's me pull data off the camera to my phone without having to get the card out of the camera. I have not had any issues with the mounts even in my high horsepower car and with my heavy foot. There was a firmware update that was available on the website and the update process was super easy. Plenty of features with this camera and I will continue to play around with the settings as I find what is best for me. Would reccomend for sure.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
Author: Brady Bunch
Title: Vantrue E2
Body: The Vantrue E2 camera system was easy to install in my 2014 Corolla. Install took about an hour and a half. Setup was simple and straightforward. I like how compact the cameras are as they do not obscure any viewpoints out of my windows. I am impressed with the quality of this product and I do recommend. Connection to my phone was simple and the ability to download videos to your phone was a big selling point for me as well as the video quality. The voice feature is also an added bonus, just tell the camera to take photo and it does, no hands needed, I like that in case I ever need a quick photo of what is happening out on the road. Vantrue has a happy customer with this product, keep up the great work.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2022
Author: Oyatho
Title: Fantastic Dash Cam
Body: I just received the new Vantrue E2 2.5K WiFi Dual Dash cam. By far one of my best purchases. The clarity it superb, and it records in 2k in each camera which is definitely ok because it actually looks like 4K in my opinion. I also installed it with the Vantrue 11.5ft Type C USB 12V 24V. Hardwire kit which was an easy install that took me approximately 30min for a seamless look. I did hook it to an accessory fuse because I don’t need the continuous option because I park in my garage. The voice activated function is also a bonus because living in Las Vegas can be an issue having to manually push a button to take still photos on the busy freeway. WiFi is easy to connect and have had zero issues. I would highly recommend this dash cam for value in price, functionality, and clarity.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2022
Author: Febe Lejeune
Title: Phenomenal! Outstanding! The best investment!
Body: This product is spectacular. Honestly, I can’t imagine driving without it. I discover more amazing features every day. The set up of the dash cam was easy and took less than 5 minutes. I was blown away by the state of the art app and the ease of downloading the videos and pictures onto my phone gallery. I never seen a dash cam that films the rear as well! This is amazing in case someone rear ends you. You are totally protected and covered with this camera. My mouth dropped when I opened the app and saw the video and the gps tracker show in real time where I was on the map. The remote works great and so easy to capture videos and sound. I also enjoy the extra protection when my car is in park. The fact that it can record if someone hits my car or if someone from my apartment complex tries to break in is mind blowing. I cannot believe how advanced this is. I am one happy customer

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2022
Author: V Nguyen
Title: Still within this world
Body: Needed a dual front and rear dashcam for my car and have used prior vantrue cams before so I gave this a try. It's like any other dash cam, but the front cam is a bit sleeker in design, and compact. Video quality during the day time is great but as with other dashcam, night time is good but still can have issues reading license plates clearly. I have installed other cams before, but you do have to take some time installing the rear one by running the cable, but it's not too hard. Overall, I can recommend this camera but don't expect out of JWST out of this world image quality.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
Author: Nils
Title: Easy and simple to install
Body: Let's start with dashcams in general. Dashcams can offer several benefits to drivers. For example, they can serve as evidence in the event of accidents or unexpected incidents to clarify the causes of the incident. They can also help locate stolen vehicles by possibly containing images of people or vehicles seen near the scene of the crime.Additionally, dashcams can contribute to improving road safety by reminding drivers to observe safety rules such as obeying speed limits or avoiding distractions such as using phones while driving. In summary, dashcams can help improve road safety and serve as a valuable tool in analyzing traffic accidents or thefts.Let's move on to the hardcore technical details. Both cameras have a resolution of 2.5K and are Wi-Fi compatible, offering GPS tracking. There is also a smart voice control. Both cameras have a field of view of 160°. The package that I was kindly provided with includes:  2.5K Front Dash Cam  2.5K Rear Camera  Wireless Remote Controller  Rear Camera Cable (20FT)  Magnetic GPS Mount  4.8A Fast Car Charger  USB Cable (3.3FT, for transferring files only)  Electrostatic Stickers  Warning Stickers; Crowbar;  User ManualThere is also additional hardware that is available separately. A polarizing filter, which filters the reflection of the front and rear windshield, or a hardwire kit, which enables a 24-hour parking mode. This is then linked to motion detection and saves a video clip of a total of 35 seconds in the event of motion. 5 seconds before and 30 seconds after the motion.First step - Firmware updateFirst, we insert an SD card into the front camera housing. The rear camera also records on the same memory card via USB-C connection, so it must also be a correspondingly fast SD card. The storage size is secondary, as only a maximum loop of 5 minutes is possible.After formatting the SD card from the dashcam, we can establish a direct connection to the laptop or PC with the supplied USB-C cable and copy the firmware to the SD card.Second step - Installation in the carI need to provide a little background information. We currently have a 2006 Toyota Sienna. Many components are already outdated, loose, and a little worn out. With the help of the included plastic pry bar, for example, the cable for the rear camera could be laid pretty easily. So well, in fact, that it is completely hidden.For the front camera, I was forced to not mount it on the windshield according to DC regulations of the DMV. Now it sticks to the dashboard and holds surprisingly well. The power supply is regulated via the car charger, and fortunately, you don't lose a possible USB charging port thanks to the built-in USB ports.As soon as the power is turned on via the car's ignition, both cameras turn on and start recording immediately. With a push of the left of the four buttons, you can stop a recording and check the settings first. I had to flip the image because the camera is basically upside down - it went smoothly.Overall the image quality is top-notch. The entire scope of delivery really leaves nothing to be desired. A first start into the world of self-optimization in road traffic is very easy and straightforward with the Vantrue E2 set. What I would be interested in myself is how the installation works in a car from the last 2 years.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2022
Author: Dawn
Title: Must have!
Body: My family has used several in the past, however, they had different issues or lacked the options I desired. What I like the most about this dash camera is the ease of setup and the bang for the buck. Tip - Load the app and use a phone live view while setting up as you can easily see what the view will be from the back of your vehicle while mounting.)All you need to be fully up, and running is a micro sd card which is cheap these days thankfully. I was able to get this installed in less than 30 minutes which included running a cable down the side of my car to the rear hatch.In terms of features, this had everything I was looking for.-Front and rear cameras with a solid feel to the unit. (Nothing flimsy and the cables provided are nice quality.)-Remote control. You can mute the camera and take photos from the remote. Remote does not need to be hard-wired.-Voice-activated. You can simply say take a photo and voila, you have a photo. This is super nifty when you want a photo or something to be done and do not want to be distracted by a remote or camera buttons. (I did notice there are no commands listed in the manual. You can view a list of these in the camera settings.) And yes, you can turn on and off the "take photo" noise pending your taste.-Has built-in GPS, shows MPH, and offers dual 2.5K resolution recording. (This means a lot if you ever need to pull footage and actually have the ability to read license plates, etc.)Another cool feature to me is the Wifi ability as none of my other cameras had this. This allows you to view-download from your camera wirelessly using the free app. Before I had to remove the micro sd card and put it on a pc to view and work with. This saves me a lot of time. The app is very well laid out and makes finding the video you are looking for super easy. The wifi-app feature is also incredibly easy to use and helpful when going through the settings on your camera. Instead of pushing the buttons on the unit, you can just go into the app and change whatever settings you need quickly and from your phone.The video has proven to be sharp, and I like the fact they use Sony Starvis sensors vs. a cheaper one. The viewing angle is also greater than many of the other cameras which let you have a wider viewing angle at 160degrees. It should also be noted that the F1.8 on the sensor was appealing and does very well in low light without getting grainy. (If you used dash cams before at night, you will know how much this can be an issue.)I hope to never actually “need” this, but it is a peace of mind deal, and hoping this will remain strong for years to come. The only investment I plan on making is going for the 512GB micro sd card vs. the 64GB card I am using.

Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
Author: Topher
Title: Vantrue helped me out.
Body: I emailed Vantrue's customer service about the suction cup mount of my Vantrue N2 Pro Dashcam. Here in FL it gets really warm and the suction cup tends to fall off quite a bit. So I would get into my car and the dash cam would be swaying from its power cord, so frustrating. Vantrue shipped me a free adhesive mount and so far it seems to be doing the trick. I really appreciate good customer service when I see it, thanks guys!
